alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 3:08PM EST until January 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TUESDAY TO 1 PM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain mixed expected. Total ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Carbon and Monroe. * WHEN...From 7 AM Tuesday to 1 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods light precipitation will move into the area from west to east Tuesday morning and continue through Tuesday, Tuesday night, and into Wednesday. Freezing rain mixed at times with sleet and even a little snow can be expected at elevations above 1200 feet with a change to rain likely for a time Tuesday afternoon in the lower elevations before a change back to a wintry mix at night. All areas are expected to see any lingering precipitation change to rain Wednesday afternoon. Ice accumulations over the duration of the event could be upwards of two tenths of an inch over the Pocono Plateau but should be limited to several hundredths of an inch below 1200 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
